sentence.Network_en: The Matterhorn , its summit too steep to hold a snowfield.
sentence.Network_cn: 马特峰的山峰因为过于陡斜而无法积雪.

sentence.Network_en: At that moment, the rabbit didn't hide or escape, but crept tightly upon the snowfield.
sentence.Network_cn: 在那一瞬间, 灰兔并没有躲藏或是逃跑, 而是紧紧地匍匐在雪地上.

entry.def: A snowfield is a large area which is always covered in snow.

means.word_mean: 1. a permanent wide expanse of snow

auth_sentence.content: The highest mountain in western New Guinea carries a permanent snowfield although it is almost on the equator.
auth_sentence.res_content: The highest mountain in western New Guinea carries a permanent snowfield although it is almost on the equator.
